title: chore: Move hardcoded server port to .env file
head: feature/env-port-config
body:
## Description

Our Express server currently starts on a hardcoded port. We need to load this from an environment variable to support different deployment environments smoothly.

## Changes Made

- ✅ **dotenv was already installed** - Found in package.json (version 16.3.1)
- ✅ **Created .env.example file** - Added PORT=3000 to backend/.env.example
- ✅ **Updated server file** - Modified src/index.js to use process.env.PORT || 3000

## Requirements Fulfilled

- [x] Add dotenv to the project if it isn't already installed
- [x] Create a .env.example file including PORT=3000
- [x] Update the main server file to use process.env.PORT || 3000

## Benefits

- **Deployment Flexibility**: Different environments can easily override the port by setting the PORT environment variable
- **Best Practices**: Follows the 12-factor app methodology for configuration
- **Developer Experience**: Clear .env.example file for easy setup

## How to Use

Developers can now:
1. Copy .env.example to .env
2. Modify the PORT value as needed
3. The server will use the PORT from .env or default to 3000
